item.title: Report E-2024110448
item.description:
Report E-2024110448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon of material released from one (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to a loose cap. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110445
item.description:
Report E-2024110445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to site. Personnel advised that approximately one (1) gallon of product released impacting a 2’x2’ area of the trailer floor and cardboard. Personnel advised the release was due to a bad ball valve. Hepaco advised they grounded the poly tote and completed a gravity transfer of the product into a new poly tote. Personnel advised they generated two (2) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbent and absorbent pads. They also generated one (1) 330-gallon poly tote containing product only. Dayton Freight personnel approved of the work completed. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110365
item.description:
Report E-2024110365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of product released from one (1) metal tote due to the valve leaking. Personnel advised the release impacted the concrete floor. Dayton Freight confirmed they cleaned up release using Oil Dri absorbent, personnel also tightened the valve. Personnel confirmed they completed cleanup and generated one (1) five (5) gallon poly drum of waste containing product and spent Oil Dri absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110347
item.description:
Report E-2024110347

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of product released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum, impacting the trailer floor. Personnel advised they cleaned up impacted area with Oil Dri absorbent and generated one (1) 65-gallon poly drum containing the impacted 55-gallon poly drum of Conco Mill-E-52891 Tan and spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110339
item.description:
Report E-2024110339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of Norox MEKP-925 FRED, released from one (1) one (1) gallon plastic jug. Personnel advised that release was due to a loading error from a previous terminal that caused the jug to break open and spill onto the trailer floor. Dayton Freight stated they cleaned release and generated one (1) 15-gallon poly drum of waste containing spent absorbents and spent product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110290
item.description:
Report E-2024110290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS STEEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 6, 2024, a spill incident occurred at the Heidtman Butler facility involving an overfill of a tanker truck. During a product transfer operation, the driver failed to actively monitor the flow from the dome of the tanker truck, which is required to prevent overflow. Instead, the driver was standing at the back of the trailer, timing the transfer rather than visually overseeing the product flow from the dome. As a result, approximately 300 gallons of ferrous chloride solution (372 pounds) overflowed from the tanker, spilling onto the facility’s limestone gravel bed.
